description.narrative: Objective Strengthen the management of Togos protected area system to improve its contribution to biodiversity conservation by demonstrating effective approaches to PA rehabilitation and management
2 Estimated permanent and temporary populations of Elephants in Togo are increasing

comment.narrative: 70 permanent estimation 2010
At least 90 permanent return of the 20 1990 elephants in OtiKéran

Limited progress towards target
There were no formal agreements between the authorities in charge of PAs and the local communities but the works to establish the requalification records have continued during 2014 Consensual demarcation of protected areas of OKM complex that could not be completed because of resistance shown by communities motivated by resentment toward the previous mode PAs management and that were influenced by influential people from the area intervention This consequently delays all operations leading to the participatory development of comanagement agreements the management plan including zoning associated regulations and the business plan To reduce this barrier the project with the support of the Minister of the Environment held meetings with executives and opinion leaders and with the support of the prefects with local communities to raise awareness on profits related to PA An action plan to achieve consensual boundaries of OKM complex was presented to the parties concerned to promote their adherence to interventions in the field Thus during the same period partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri has established a document signed by all the different actors village chiefs presidents of AVGAPs and representatives of the residents close to the protected area the CVD presidents The development of an Information Action Plan EducationCommunication will generate general support for PAs and biodiversity conservation
The MTR notes
This indicator is not an outcome indicator and should not be at this level The management tools are products and their preparation is not an effect It would be more appropriate to use an indicator of the effect of the application of these management tools
At least 90 permanent return of the 20 1990 elephants in OtiKéran

Limited progress towards target
There were no formal agreements between the authorities in charge of PAs and the local communities but the works to establish the requalification records have continued during 2014 Consensual demarcation of protected areas of OKM complex that could not be completed because of resistance shown by communities motivated by resentment toward the previous mode PAs management and that were influenced by influential people from the area intervention This consequently delays all operations leading to the participatory development of comanagement agreements the management plan including zoning associated regulations and the business plan To reduce this barrier the project with the support of the Minister of the Environment held meetings with executives and opinion leaders and with the support of the prefects with local communities to raise awareness on profits related to PA An action plan to achieve consensual boundaries of OKM complex was presented to the parties concerned to promote their adherence to interventions in the field Thus during the same period partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri has established a document signed by all the different actors village chiefs presidents of AVGAPs and representatives of the residents close to the protected area the CVD presidents The development of an Information Action Plan EducationCommunication will generate general support for PAs and biodiversity conservation
The MTR notes
This indicator is not an outcome indicator and should not be at this level The management tools are products and their preparation is not an effect It would be more appropriate to use an indicator of the effect of the application of these management tools

description.narrative: 1 Coverage of the National Protected Area System of Togo

comment.narrative:
A dysfunctional PA Estate 793000 ha in 83 sites many of which serve no conservation purpose and are currently a burden for the PA system
The status for the 10 priority sites is described in PRODOC Table 1
These are
1 FazaoMalfakassaAnié
2 Abdoulaye
3 OtiKéran OtiMandouri Complex
4 Togodo SouthNorth
5 Bayémé
6 AmouMono
7 TchillaMonota
8 Alédjo
9 Lions Den
10 Assévé and Godjinmé

A rationalized PA estate 578250 ha with 456883 ha in 10 priority PA
Proposed midterm target
Completing the reclassification process for 10 priority sites sites and having accurate maps on Google Earth to visualise land use patterns for the remainder sites is an adequate project target by midterm
Note on logframe revision 2013 The proposed midterm target is accepted by the RTA

The midterm target is not reached but well underway
Pursuing the objective of securing 578250 ha the project has worked in 2014 to get the support of local populations and other interested parties and implement partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri Thus 36 of this PA perimeters have been secured These operations should continue and be completed in 2015
Quoting from the MTR
Project interventions for requalification of APs system have focused so far on 4 of the 10 priority APs identified in the draft document of AP added during the project Consensual delimitation and demarcation of transactions with community participation helped secure over 129 000 ha area for the following APs
FazaoMalfakassa 100 000 ha 52 approx
Aledjo approx 1 000 ha
Balam approx 5000 ha and OtiKeran 42 milestones on about 30 km some limits are still confined in the Prefecture of Keran and ten km limit in the prefecture of Oti
Togodo South North and Abdoulaye have been delineated and bounded by DERF with other supports
OKM for the complex this step is a prerequisite for the development and implementation of protected areas management tools and the low level of progress affects other achievements This delay is linked to difficult access due to the resistance of the people who occupy or use land within the APs
The precise geographical coordinates of all terminals located around the APs are available for FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo Balam and OtiKeran Requalification Files are being prepared for Abdoulaye Togodo North South FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo and Balam and OKM
The digitization of the polygons of the 10 priority APs has been completed for the establishment of the geographic database
The MTR notes
The midterm target is not reached but well underway The obstacles that have slowed consensual delineation activities have been removed and most of the local communities are willing to adhere to the objectives of the project to the extent that the minimum conditions for their subsistence are provided improvement of soil productivity and access water and where concrete achievements attest to the willingness of the State to improve the management of protected areas for the benefit of local residents
A change to the indicator formulation for clarity is provided by the MTR

A rationalized PA estate 578250 ha with 456883 ha in 10 priority PA
Proposed midterm target
Completing the reclassification process for 10 priority sites sites and having accurate maps on Google Earth to visualise land use patterns for the remainder sites is an adequate project target by midterm
Note on logframe revision 2013 The proposed midterm target is accepted by the RTA

The midterm target is not reached but well underway
Pursuing the objective of securing 578250 ha the project has worked in 2014 to get the support of local populations and other interested parties and implement partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri Thus 36 of this PA perimeters have been secured These operations should continue and be completed in 2015
Quoting from the MTR
Project interventions for requalification of APs system have focused so far on 4 of the 10 priority APs identified in the draft document of AP added during the project Consensual delimitation and demarcation of transactions with community participation helped secure over 129 000 ha area for the following APs
FazaoMalfakassa 100 000 ha 52 approx
Aledjo approx 1 000 ha
Balam approx 5000 ha and OtiKeran 42 milestones on about 30 km some limits are still confined in the Prefecture of Keran and ten km limit in the prefecture of Oti
Togodo South North and Abdoulaye have been delineated and bounded by DERF with other supports
OKM for the complex this step is a prerequisite for the development and implementation of protected areas management tools and the low level of progress affects other achievements This delay is linked to difficult access due to the resistance of the people who occupy or use land within the APs
The precise geographical coordinates of all terminals located around the APs are available for FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo Balam and OtiKeran Requalification Files are being prepared for Abdoulaye Togodo North South FazaoMalfakassa Alédjo and Balam and OKM
The digitization of the polygons of the 10 priority APs has been completed for the establishment of the geographic database
The MTR notes
The midterm target is not reached but well underway The obstacles that have slowed consensual delineation activities have been removed and most of the local communities are willing to adhere to the objectives of the project to the extent that the minimum conditions for their subsistence are provided improvement of soil productivity and access water and where concrete achievements attest to the willingness of the State to improve the management of protected areas for the benefit of local residents
A change to the indicator formulation for clarity is provided by the MTR

description.narrative: 3 PA in the Savannah biome of the OKM complex have zoning management and business plans which include biodiversity conservation and riparian communities needs and are enforced

comment.narrative:
PA 0
Agreements DFC local communities represented by 10 AVGAPs and 4 UAVGAPs concerning comanagement and natural resource use in PAs 0

PA 2
Agreements DFC local communities represented by 10 AVGAPs and 4 UAVGAPs concerning comanagement and natural resource use in PAs â 14

There were no formal agreements between the authorities in charge of PAs and the local communities but the works to establish the requalification records have continued during 2014 Consensual demarcation of protected areas of OKM complex that could not be completed because of resistance shown by communities motivated by resentment toward the previous mode PAs management and that were influenced by influential people from the area intervention This consequently delays all operations leading to the participatory development of comanagement agreements the management plan including zoning associated regulations and the business plan
To reduce this barrier the project with the support of the Minister of the Environment held meetings with executives and opinion leaders and with the support of the prefects with local communities to raise awareness on profits related to PA An action plan to achieve consensual boundaries of OKM complex was presented to the parties concerned to promote their adherence to interventions in the field Thus during the same period partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri has established a document signed by all the different actors village chiefs presidents of AVGAPs and representatives of the residents close to the protected area the CVD presidents
The development of an Information Action Plan EducationCommunication will generate general support for PAs and biodiversity conservation

PA 2
Agreements DFC local communities represented by 10 AVGAPs and 4 UAVGAPs concerning comanagement and natural resource use in PAs â 14

There were no formal agreements between the authorities in charge of PAs and the local communities but the works to establish the requalification records have continued during 2014 Consensual demarcation of protected areas of OKM complex that could not be completed because of resistance shown by communities motivated by resentment toward the previous mode PAs management and that were influenced by influential people from the area intervention This consequently delays all operations leading to the participatory development of comanagement agreements the management plan including zoning associated regulations and the business plan
To reduce this barrier the project with the support of the Minister of the Environment held meetings with executives and opinion leaders and with the support of the prefects with local communities to raise awareness on profits related to PA An action plan to achieve consensual boundaries of OKM complex was presented to the parties concerned to promote their adherence to interventions in the field Thus during the same period partial demarcation of the PA OtiMandouri has established a document signed by all the different actors village chiefs presidents of AVGAPs and representatives of the residents close to the protected area the CVD presidents
The development of an Information Action Plan EducationCommunication will generate general support for PAs and biodiversity conservation

description.narrative: 5 Improved financial sustainability of PA management agency measured by increased scores of the Financial Sustainability Scorecard broken down by 4 subindicators

comment.narrative:
Scorecard Component 1 Legal and regulatory framework
179 baseline was 14 out of 82
Scorecard Component 2 Business planning
0 baseline was 0 out of 67
Scorecard Component3 Tools for revenue generation 7 baseline was 4 out of 57
5a Total 87 baseline was 18 out of 206
Other scorecard indicators to be monitored at the PA systems level are
5b
Under Finances available Item 5
Total finances available to the PA system 200K pa in 2009
5c
Costs and Financing Needs Items 2A and 2B
Estimation of financing needs for basic and optimal management ranging between 14M and 20M pa in 2009 for 10 priority sites though with no explanations on the figure
5d
Financing Gap Items 2 and 3 Annual financing gap for basic and optimal management ranging between 138M and 198M pa in 2009
NOTE ON LOGFRAME 2014 slight correction in the numbering made for the sake of clarity and correct correspondence

5a Total score by end of project expressed in percentage terms increases to at least 18
5b at least 2M by project end
5c a realistic and attainable figure is proposed for the 10 priority sites and for the entire PA system eg based on costs per hectares for specific subsystems and with explanatory notes provided covering both for basic and optimal management scenarios
5d gap for basic management below 3M pa by project end

Target achieved
Results of the dashboard on the financing of the APs system completed in 2014
Legal and regulatory framework 33 3296
Planning of activities 2 154
Revenue generation tools 8 671
Total 176 39221
The observed overall improvement has reached the intended target at the end of the project It is mainly due to an improvement in legal regulatory and institutional
The MTR notes
International technical assistance is provided in the project for a study to propose a funding strategy to mobilize various sources dedicated to the management of the APs Togo system

5a Total score by end of project expressed in percentage terms increases to at least 18
5b at least 2M by project end
5c a realistic and attainable figure is proposed for the 10 priority sites and for the entire PA system eg based on costs per hectares for specific subsystems and with explanatory notes provided covering both for basic and optimal management scenarios
5d gap for basic management below 3M pa by project end

Target achieved

Total 176 39221
The observed overall improvement has reached the intended target at the end of the project It is mainly due to an improvement in legal regulatory and institutional
The MTR notes
International technical assistance is provided in the project for a study to propose a funding strategy to mobilize various sources dedicated to the management of the APs Togo system

description.narrative: 4 Improved competence levels and standards of the institution responsible for PA measured by increased scores of the Capacity Development Scorecard

comment.narrative:
See PRODOC Annex 4 for a complete baseline reference
Total 35 out of 96

Scores expressed in absolute terms increase by at least 20
Total 42out of 96

Target achieved as validated by the MTR
Policy Development
systemic 56
institutional 13
Implementation
systemic 79
institutional 1727
individual 512
Commitment consensus
systemic 36
institutional 36
individual 23
Information and knowledge
systemic 23
institutional 23
individual 23
Monitoring
Systemic 26
institutional 36
individual 13
TOTAL 5596
The project reports
The development of PAs Management Capacity for the branch staff in charge of PAs and other stakeholders include 30 people trained in antipoaching and 60 people trained in protected area management interfaces peripheries including conflict management around PAs 30 people trained in management and participatory monitoring 30 people were equipped on features and management of protected areas and peripheries the protected areas monitoring strategy and selforganization for participatory monitoring This prelude to the establishment and operationalization of a system of participatory management and monitoring of complex OKM Organization of a study tour with 20 people conducted in Benin
The MTR reports
The development APs in management capacity for the staff of the Directorate in charge of APs and other stakeholders include
27 decision makers have received training on the use of the METT tool by the regional office of IUCN
45 managers trained in comanagement of APs
Twenty executives capable of driving the process of delimitation and demarcation of consensual APs with neighboring communities negotiation skills and GPS use
Forty executives trained in collection techniques and data analysis of the walking wildlife inventory and processing of census data
Training of members of AVGAP PA management comanagement support of AVGAP and UAVGAP
The MTR notes
Scrutiny on the results of the implementation of the tracking tool of management efficiency APs METT applied to the APs OKM complex revealed that the form had not been filled consistently this which calls into question the effectiveness of specific training in the use of this tool Given the special issues associated with APs and local communities in Togo it is essential that managers of protected areas have the tools and capacity in social mobilization and communication
The overall improvement observed using the Scorecard on capacity development than the intended target at the end of the project It is mainly related to the improvement of institutional and individual capacities to implement policies legislation strategies and programs
The current legal framework Articles 8186 LCE and Forestry Code include provisions on the creation of protected areas or areas but does not define the requirements for their creation and management nor foresee the modalities of their management and benefit sharing

The MTR reports
The development APs in management capacity for the staff of the Directorate in charge of APs and other stakeholders include
27 decision makers have received training on the use of the METT tool by the regional office of IUCN
45 managers trained in comanagement of APs
Twenty executives capable of driving the process of delimitation and demarcation of consensual APs with neighboring communities negotiation skills and GPS use
Forty executives trained in collection techniques and data analysis of the walking wildlife inventory and processing of census data
Training of members of AVGAP PA management comanagement support of AVGAP and UAVGAP
The MTR notes
Scrutiny on the results of the implementation of the tracking tool of management efficiency APs METT applied to the APs OKM complex revealed that the form had not been filled consistently this which calls into question the effectiveness of specific training in the use of this tool Given the special issues associated with APs and local communities in Togo it is essential that managers of protected areas have the tools and capacity in social mobilization and communication
The overall improvement observed using the Scorecard on capacity development than the intended target at the end of the project It is mainly related to the improvement of institutional and individual capacities to implement policies legislation strategies and programs
The current legal framework Articles 8186 LCE and Forestry Code include provisions on the creation of protected areas or areas but does not define the requirements for their creation and management nor foresee the modalities of their management and benefit sharing

description.narrative: 6 Legal status of redemarcated PAs of the OKM Complex

comment.narrative:
2 redemarcated PAs officially gazetted end of 2nd project year ie 2015
Note on logframe revision 2013 The year for the proposed midterm target should be 2015

Steady progress towards target
The reaffirmation of the will of the government that has shown its determination to implement the forest policy in Togo through the circular note No 261 PM SGG 2015 of 28 April 2015 addressed to the Honourable Members to the National Assembly to Ministers and Secretaries of State should reduce the interference of some political men in PA management especially in the complex OKM A review of the legal framework of PAs and a proposal for an improved framework and adapted to the context of decentralization were conducted in parallel with the evaluation of institutional and human framework that will provide Togo with an action plan strengthening human and material capacities necessary tool for planning the management of PAs To ensure that all local stakeholders at the OKM complex effectively participate in major decisions about AP and find local conflict management solutions a Local Management Committee GLC was established and all organs installed during a Constitutive General Assembly But overall the legal position of the PA OKM Complex is improving rather slowly The initiation of actions to improve the legal regulatory and institutional by the project review of the legal and institutional framework setting up a local management committee of the complex OKM etc and supported by the DRF 2014 should help to improve the legal position of OKM complex
The MTR notes
Over 50 dossiers of consensual demarcation were signed with local residents in order to complete requalification records
A review of the legal framework for APs analyzed the sorting options decommissioning and retraining and proposed an improved framework adapted to the context of decentralization
One study evaluated the feasibility of the creation and operation of a regional structure that would be responsible for coordinating the management of APs in the OKM complex ensuring the participation of stakeholders including AVGAP and UAVGAP major decisions Management

2 redemarcated PAs officially gazetted end of 2nd project year ie 2015
Note on logframe revision 2013 The year for the proposed midterm target should be 2015

Steady progress towards target
The reaffirmation of the will of the government that has shown its determination to implement the forest policy in Togo through the circular note No 261 PM SGG 2015 of 28 April 2015 addressed to the Honourable Members to the National Assembly to Ministers and Secretaries of State should reduce the interference of some political men in PA management especially in the complex OKM A review of the legal framework of PAs and a proposal for an improved framework and adapted to the context of decentralization were conducted in parallel with the evaluation of institutional and human framework that will provide Togo with an action plan strengthening human and material capacities necessary tool for planning the management of PAs To ensure that all local stakeholders at the OKM complex effectively participate in major decisions about AP and find local conflict management solutions a Local Management Committee GLC was established and all organs installed during a Constitutive General Assembly But overall the legal position of the PA OKM Complex is improving rather slowly The initiation of actions to improve the legal regulatory and institutional by the project review of the legal and institutional framework setting up a local management committee of the complex OKM etc and supported by the DRF 2014 should help to improve the legal position of OKM complex
The MTR notes
Over 50 dossiers of consensual demarcation were signed with local residents in order to complete requalification records
A review of the legal framework for APs analyzed the sorting options decommissioning and retraining and proposed an improved framework adapted to the context of decentralization
One study evaluated the feasibility of the creation and operation of a regional structure that would be responsible for coordinating the management of APs in the OKM complex ensuring the participation of stakeholders including AVGAP and UAVGAP major decisions Management

description.narrative:
9 Income generation from new PA and biodiversity value chains for local communities ecotourism benefit sharing small game farming local job creation etc
renumbered

comment.narrative: To be identified during management and business plan elaboration for each zone

Not possible to inform indicator
New Value Chains revenue generation from PA and biodiversity to local communities ecotourism profit sharing small game breeding creation of local jobs etc started in 2014 around the complex OKM In supporting the development of sustainable livelihoods helping to reduce pressure on resources the project has funded about 10 AGR benefiting communities located on the periphery of the complex PA OKM beekeeping shea butter production worth almost 65 million CFA francs The project financed 10 AGR benefiting communities located on the periphery of the complex PAs OKM beekeeping shea butter production worth more than 125 000 The materialization of production materials provided direct resources to the local population in the form of local workforce of over 7000 and over 5000 dollars in purchasing the construction equipment in Borgou Over a hundred people in local communities of which 30 are women have benefited from these contributions
MTR notes and also makes suggestions to chaning the indicator
In supporting the development of sustainable livelihoods contributing to reduce pressure on resources
The project has funded about 10 AGR benefiting communities located on the outskirts of the APs OKM complex beekeeping shea butter production
The work of materialization of the limits of APs manufacture of terminals have brought revenues of nearly five million CFA francs a month in a hundred people in local communities including 25 women but the income is not unsustainable
To be identified during management and business plan elaboration for each zone

Not possible to inform indicator

MTR notes and also makes suggestions to chaning the indicator

The work of materialization of the limits of APs manufacture of terminals have brought revenues of nearly five million CFA francs a month in a hundred people in local communities including 25 women but the income is not unsustainable

Not possible to inform indicator
The project reports
In 2014 the regeneration of ecosystems and habitats in both protected areas OKM Complex has not been measured although the land cover map for all OKM complex was developed from the processing of satellite images Landsat 8 But as was also pointed out the midterm with the sharp increase of human occupation within the PA it seems unrealistic to achieve reduction of the cultivated area in half by the end of the Project especially considering that compensation could be granted for communities to voluntarily leave the PA It is considered an alternative measure for the reduction of pressure by reducing the number of people living in the 54 communities installed in the grip of complex The land use map for the whole OKM complex should be improved through timely and more accurate data using the new digital topographic map of Togo and high resolution RapidEye satellite image acquired in 2013 by the Ministry
Quoting the MTR
In support of the surrounding communities the project
Designed in new water points on the periphery of the OKM AP complex with the construction of two pump wells powered by solar energy and NGambi Natiponi
Started the process of rehabilitation of wells and former earth dams and rainwater retention reservoirs and streams during the rainy season
Offered training on making compost whose adoption by farmers is limited due to supply constraints straw and water
Furthermore the MTR made several recommendations about changing this indicator completely

â 50 reduced habitat conversion
OtiKéran â 9 of the surface of the core protection zone occupied by agriculture
OtiMandouri â 8 of the surface of the core protection zone occupied by agriculture
Reduced human pressure in the OKM complex â 10000 people living in 20 villages inside the complex

Not possible to inform indicator
The project reports
In 2014 the regeneration of ecosystems and habitats in both protected areas OKM Complex has not been measured although the land cover map for all OKM complex was developed from the processing of satellite images Landsat 8 But as was also pointed out the midterm with the sharp increase of human occupation within the PA it seems unrealistic to achieve reduction of the cultivated area in half by the end of the Project especially considering that compensation could be granted for communities to voluntarily leave the PA It is considered an alternative measure for the reduction of pressure by reducing the number of people living in the 54 communities installed in the grip of complex The land use map for the whole OKM complex should be improved through timely and more accurate data using the new digital topographic map of Togo and high resolution RapidEye satellite image acquired in 2013 by the Ministry
Quoting the MTR
In support of the surrounding communities the project
Designed in new water points on the periphery of the OKM AP complex with the construction of two pump wells powered by solar energy and NGambi Natiponi
Started the process of rehabilitation of wells and former earth dams and rainwater retention reservoirs and streams during the rainy season
Offered training on making compost whose adoption by farmers is limited due to supply constraints straw and water
Furthermore the MTR made several recommendations about changing this indicator completely

description.narrative: 7 Improved PA management effectiveness at the two PA sites OtiKéran Oti Mandouri of the OKM complex for general management and business planning as measured by increases in the METT scores

comment.narrative:
Scores 2010
OtiKéran 265
Oti Mandouri 157

Target achieved
The project reports
The effectiveness of PA management on both AP sites OtiKeran Oti Mandouri of OKM Complex for the general management plan and activities measured by METT scores yielded
35 for the AP OtiKeran
34 for OtiMandouri in 2014
Although the evaluation of the scores vary greatly dependent on the actors who respond if the actors are not the same it calls into question the validity of comparisons over time however there is a net improvement in these scores moving from 265 baseline to 35 in 2014 for the AP OtiKeran reaching the end of project target This target is also widely exceeded regarding the management of the PA OtiMandouri from 157 baseline to 34 in 2014 against a target project completion 274 This progress is partly explained by awareness campaigns AVGAP revitalizing and strengthening the capacities of stakeholders involved in the management of this complex for monitoring of the AP and antipoaching In addition to these trainings brigade Naboulgou has two motorcycles four buildings dormitories of this brigade are being rehabilitated and a brigade is under construction in Borgou The latter benefited from the support of a significant part of village community by granting a plot of 2 ha in Borgou for the construction of this station
The MTR reports
The assessment of the effectiveness of PA management Oti Keran a 25 b 35 Oti Mandouri a 22 b 34 Abdoulaye Fazao Malfakassa 59 Balam 23 and Alédjo 33
The effectiveness of PA management of OKM complex was assessed in April 2014 with the METT assessment tool This assessment was reviewed during the mid term with the project team and having found gaps in responses scores and comments were fully revised which resulted in an overall assessment significantly APs for high Oti Oti Keran and Mandouri 34 and 35 instead of 22 and 25 reaching the intended target at the end of the project

The effectiveness of PA management on both AP sites OtiKeran Oti Mandouri of OKM Complex for the general management plan and activities measured by METT scores returned 35 for the AP OtiKeran and 34 for OtiMandouri in 2014
Although the evaluation of the scores vary greatly dependent on the actors who respond if the actors are not the same it calls into question the validity of comparisons over time however there is a net improvement in these scores moving from 265 baseline to 35 in 2014 for the AP OtiKeran reaching the end of project target This target is also widely exceeded regarding the management of the PA OtiMandouri from 157 baseline to 34 in 2014 against a target project completion 274
This progress is partly explained by awareness campaigns AVGAP revitalizing and strengthening the capacities of stakeholders involved in the management of this complex for monitoring of the AP and antipoaching
In addition to these trainings brigade Naboulgou has two motorcycles four buildings dormitories of this brigade are being rehabilitated and a brigade is under construction in Borgou The latter benefited from the support of a significant part of village community by granting a plot of 2 ha in Borgou for the construction of this station

Target achieved
The project reports
The effectiveness of PA management on both AP sites OtiKeran Oti Mandouri of OKM Complex for the general management plan and activities measured by METT scores yielded
35 for the AP OtiKeran
34 for OtiMandouri in 2014
Although the evaluation of the scores vary greatly dependent on the actors who respond if the actors are not the same it calls into question the validity of comparisons over time however there is a net improvement in these scores moving from 265 baseline to 35 in 2014 for the AP OtiKeran reaching the end of project target This target is also widely exceeded regarding the management of the PA OtiMandouri from 157 baseline to 34 in 2014 against a target project completion 274 This progress is partly explained by awareness campaigns AVGAP revitalizing and strengthening the capacities of stakeholders involved in the management of this complex for monitoring of the AP and antipoaching In addition to these trainings brigade Naboulgou has two motorcycles four buildings dormitories of this brigade are being rehabilitated and a brigade is under construction in Borgou The latter benefited from the support of a significant part of village community by granting a plot of 2 ha in Borgou for the construction of this station
The MTR reports
The assessment of the effectiveness of PA management Oti Keran a 25 b 35 Oti Mandouri a 22 b 34 Abdoulaye Fazao Malfakassa 59 Balam 23 and Alédjo 33
The effectiveness of PA management of OKM complex was assessed in April 2014 with the METT assessment tool This assessment was reviewed during the mid term with the project team and having found gaps in responses scores and comments were fully revised which resulted in an overall assessment significantly APs for high Oti Oti Keran and Mandouri 34 and 35 instead of 22 and 25 reaching the intended target at the end of the project

The effectiveness of PA management on both AP sites OtiKeran Oti Mandouri of OKM Complex for the general management plan and activities measured by METT scores returned 35 for the AP OtiKeran and 34 for OtiMandouri in 2014
Although the evaluation of the scores vary greatly dependent on the actors who respond if the actors are not the same it calls into question the validity of comparisons over time however there is a net improvement in these scores moving from 265 baseline to 35 in 2014 for the AP OtiKeran reaching the end of project target This target is also widely exceeded regarding the management of the PA OtiMandouri from 157 baseline to 34 in 2014 against a target project completion 274
This progress is partly explained by awareness campaigns AVGAP revitalizing and strengthening the capacities of stakeholders involved in the management of this complex for monitoring of the AP and antipoaching
In addition to these trainings brigade Naboulgou has two motorcycles four buildings dormitories of this brigade are being rehabilitated and a brigade is under construction in Borgou The latter benefited from the support of a significant part of village community by granting a plot of 2 ha in Borgou for the construction of this station

description.narrative:
10 Critical habitats and key natural resources for elephant migration at regional level OKM WAP are identified and priority threats addressed including through WAPOKwide cooperation among the WAPOK countries
Note on logframe revision2013 The indicator has now an improve and clearer formulation and it is accepted by the RTA
renumbered

comment.narrative:
Some useful maps are contained in PRODOC Annex 9 Atlas of the project region These are not sufficiently detailed to prioritise action on critical habitats elephant migration
Note on logframe revision 2013 The indicator has now an improve and clearer formulation and it is accepted by the RTA

By midterm the project would have identified
a key habitats for elephant migration across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex
b nevralgic points for elephant poaching across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex
c At least 3 priority activities including urgent and costed actions for addressing the threats of elephant poaching across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex and requiring crossborder cooperation among the WAPOK countries
Note on logframe revision 2013 The indicator has now an improve and clearer formulation and it is accepted by the RTA 2014 renumbered to a b c

Not possible to fully inform indicator
But MTR notes
To define a migration corridor for wildlife between the OKM complex Togo and W Arly Pendjari Benin Burkina Faso Niger and to improve ecological connectivity the project has the participation of local authorities 3 prefects of the prefectures 2 canton chiefs presidents UAVGAP 2 2 and 2 NGO representatives regional Directors of the environment to find solutions to problems encountered in the implementation of field activities at the forum players WAPO in Ouagadougou Burkina Faso The participation of these representatives of Togo should contribute to the harmonization of management conservation measures within the OKM complex with the measures in place in the WAP To improve the capacity of national frameworks for PA management and facilitate the integration of Togo to regional initiatives national cadres participated in planning meetings in Benin and Burkina Faso

By midterm the project would have identified
a key habitats for elephant migration across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex
b nevralgic points for elephant poaching across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex
c At least 3 priority activities including urgent and costed actions for addressing the threats of elephant poaching across the WAPOK Complex involving the OKM SubComplex and requiring crossborder cooperation among the WAPOK countries
Note on logframe revision 2013 The indicator has now an improve and clearer formulation and it is accepted by the RTA 2014 renumbered to a b c

Not possible to fully inform indicator
But MTR notes
To define a migration corridor for wildlife between the OKM complex Togo and W Arly Pendjari Benin Burkina Faso Niger and to improve ecological connectivity the project has the participation of local authorities 3 prefects of the prefectures 2 canton chiefs presidents UAVGAP 2 2 and 2 NGO representatives regional Directors of the environment to find solutions to problems encountered in the implementation of field activities at the forum players WAPO in Ouagadougou Burkina Faso The participation of these representatives of Togo should contribute to the harmonization of management conservation measures within the OKM complex with the measures in place in the WAP To improve the capacity of national frameworks for PA management and facilitate the integration of Togo to regional initiatives national cadres participated in planning meetings in Benin and Burkina Faso

description.narrative: - Superficie du système national d'aires protégées du Togo - Populations permanentes et temporaires d'éléphants au Togo - Les AP du biome de savane du Complexe OKM disposent de plans de zonage, de gestion et d'activités, comprenant la conservation de la biodiversité et les besoins des communautés riveraines, et ils sont appliqués

comment.narrative: - Domaine d'AP dysfonctionnel : 793.000 ha dans 83 sites, dont un grand nombre n'est pas destiné à la conservation et représente actuellement un fardeau pour le système des AP - Environ 70 éléphants permanents (estimation 2010) - Accords entre la DFC et les communautés locales (représentées par 10 AVGAP et 4 UAVGAP), relatifs à la cogestion et l'utilisation des ressources naturelles des AP : 0

- Finalisation des forages - Organiser une retraite de personnes ressources et des cadres du ministère pour l’élaboration d’un programme national sur les aires protégées - Organiser des séances de formation des bénéficiaires et des comités-eau (CE) autour du parc Fazao-Malfakassa et des intermédiations sociales dans les villages bénéficiaires - Sensibiliser les populations de Fazao-Malfakassa sur la gestion des interfaces aires protégées - périphéries et les former sur la gestion des conflits Homme-éléphants; - Organiser une réunion de pilotage de projet élargie aux principales parties prenantes - Organiser une mission de suivi des activités de terrain du PRAPT

- Les travaux de forage sont finalisés - 50 membres des comités eau de 10 villages ont été formés sur les bonnes pratiques dhygiènes et de gestion des points ainsi quà lintermédiation sociale - 2000 personnes des villages autour de Fazao-Malfakassa ont été formés sur la gestion des interfaces aires protégées - périphéries et la gestion des conflits Homme-éléphants; - une mission de suivi des réalisations du projet a été organisée avec la participation du ministre de lenvironnement et dun représentant du PNUD - La réunion du comité de pilotage
